data.title: Palm Beach Atlantic University Athletics
data.meta_description:
Michael Simpson (14) F  - PERSONAL
Born July 28, 1993... Majoring in communications... Aspires to play professional basketball and work for ESPN... Favorite verse
data.text:
PERSONAL

Born July 28, 1993... Majoring in communications... Aspires to play professional basketball and work for ESPN... Favorite verse is Psalm 23:4... Favorite athlete is Ray Allen... Son of Robert and Mary Anne Simpson... Has two siblings: Beth and Brian...

2015-2016 (Senior)

Transitioned from a role player to a key offensive threat for the Sailfish, playing in 24 games on the year, making 17 starts… Averaged 22.8 minutes per game… Finished second on the team in scoring, averaging 10.7 points per game… Scored in double figures 13 times on the year…Knocked down 52-of-148 attempts from long range…Averaged 3.2 rebounds per game… Had a career game at Rollins on January 16, setting his career-high in points scored at 29, three-pointers made with eight, and rebounds grabbed with seven… Played a season-high 34 minutes at Rollins on January 16

2014-2015 (Junior)

Played in all 26 contests for the Sailfish, getting the starting nod in two of them… Averaged 17.5 minutes per game, and played at least 20 minutes in eleven contests... Averaged 7.6 points per game… Scored in double-figures on eleven occasions for the Sailfish, including two season high 15 point performances…Shot 35-percent from long distance… Finished second on the team with 45 made threes on the season, including a 5-9 performance against Rollins on February 4th… Shot 70-percent from the free throw line on the campaign… Played a season high 28 minutes vs Paine College on December 20th.

PREVIOUS COLLEGE

Attended Missouri State University where he competed on the men's basketball team

HIGH SCHOOL

Graduated from Klein Collins High School where he played on the boy's basketball team for Scott Harmatuk... Achieved a 3.6 GPA in HS... Team captain his senior year... Made All-District 13-5A junior and senior year.
